title: Is this as stupid as it looks? (Yes) - Minisforum MC560 Webcam PC
description: Thanks to Secret Lab for sponsoring today's video! Check them out at   "Boy howdy. Working from home is great, but webcams STINK. If only there was a device that combined my PC and my webcam into one device that is mediocre at both's jobs!" - No one ever  Can Jake find a killer feature in this odd device or does this seem more like manufactured e-waste?  Check out the Minisforum MC560:  UK:   Purchases made through some store links may provide some compensation to Linus Media Group.  Want us to unbox something? Make a suggestion at    GET MERCH:   LTX 2023 TICKETS AVAILABLE NOW:   GET EXCLUSIVE CONTENT ON FLOATPLANE:   AFFILIATES, SPONSORS & REFERRALS:   OUR WAN PODCAST GEAR:   FOLLOW US ELSEWHERE ---------------------------------------------------   Twitter:  Instagram:  TikTok:  Facebook:   CHAPTERS --------------------------------------------------- 0:00 WFH isn't always fun 0:33 Unboxing 1:03 Design and ports 2:50 Sponsor - Secret Lab 3:09 Booting it up and trying the webcam 5:25 Specs 6:21 Speaker test 7:13 Testing Internet speeds and running Cinebench 8:18 Playing CS:GO 8:55 Teardown 10:22 Overall thoughts 10:54 Outro

But it's such a pain in the (chicken squawks). You gotta find your webcam, find your mic, get everything ready to go. And Minisforum understands this, and they've devised solution that- I don't know if it's elegant, I guess we'll see. But it's a webcam inside of the computer tower. It's less flexible than a regular webcam probably, but at least you don't need one, and you can't lose it. That's the big thing. It's integrated. Let's, let's check it out. Let's open the box. New Gen 5 Mars Series computer. So on top of it having a webcam, it is also a fully functional computer. Wow, look at that. It's kind of pretty, actually.
